benchmark_details.name: Spider-Mismatch
benchmark_details.overview: Spider-Mismatch is a new dataset specifically designed to highlight the mismatch problem in SQL conditional clauses, which aims to bridge the gap between existing benchmarks and real-world scenarios.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To enhance the SQL generation capabilities of LLMs in real-world scenarios by addressing common database mismatch problems.

data.source: Derived from Spider and its variants by modifying questions and SQL queries.
data.annotation: Manual modification to introduce conditions that reflect real-world scenarios.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are computed based on the comparison of predicted SQL queries with gold queries.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy scores indicate better performance in generating correct SQL queries.
methodology.baseline_results: Tool-SQL outperformed existing methods by 9.6% on Spider-Mismatch using ChatGPT and 7.1% using GPT-4.
methodology.validation: Evaluation conducted against standard Text-to-SQL benchmarks.

harm: Potential misrepresentations in SQL query generation affecting real-world applications.
